xRenderforINDS Documentation

1.0

Documentation for xRender package This package generates a dataflow diagram from an INDS execution manager instance. The code is broken up into
  • HTML/CGI (xRender.py) interface
  • INDS client interface (indsInterface.py)
  • Graph generator (dictToDot.py)
  • Routines to run the external 'dot' binary and handle tempfiles (dotProcessor.py)
  • Read/write configuration file and determine operating system (osSpec.py)
  • Configuration file 'defaults.cfg'

Algorithm

  1. Read INDS hostname from config file 'defaults.cfg'
  2. Get XML config document from INDS
  3. Compute MD5 hash of same. Compare to last saved hash in 'defaults.cfg'. they match, return and do no work; the saved graph is current.
  4. Fetch list of commands from INDS.
  5. For each command:
    1. If transient, ignore (sleep, del)
    2. Otherwise, fetch the command type, nice name and XML snippet and store in an associative array keyed on the command id.
  6. Once step 5 is complete, the dictToDot code iterates over the data several times to generate a dot-language graph.
  7. dotMaker takes the output from step six and invokes the external 'dot' binary to produce an SVG (or PNG, PDF, etc) graph. This step is fragile due to the system call, and I need to see if webdot could be used instead. Note that the dot binary and its path are defined in 'defaults.cfg' to solve this.
  8. dot outputs to ../../inds-svg/inds.svg

Notes

  • Currently limited to one DataTurbine instance per graph.
  • This can be extended to generate a multi-system graph; the first thing to paramaterize would be the graph header - change graph to subgraph.

Configuration

The system configuration is defined and kept in defaults.cfg. See osSpec.py for details. An example is also included; rename it to defaults.cfg.
